OFFICE O
The Bualit
NARASARAOPET (R.O)4.
You are on the only son born in my womb. Out of my love and affection for you, and in order to ensure your well-being in the future, I have resolved to bequeath to you some immovable property, and I hereby grant you the following schedule, valued at Rs. 6,07,000-00, six lakh seven thousand rupees, as a gift, and I hereby give you possession of the schedule property, with all rights, as a gift, free of charge, and as a gift. Therefore, from now on, you shall retain the Scheduled Property in your possession and pay the Panchayat taxes, etc. payable to the Scheduled Property, and enjoy it as you wish, with full rights of donation, possession, exchange, and sale, to the fullest extent of the moon. If you enjoy it in this way, I and my successors will never be able to bring you, your successors, or my successors into any kind of dispute, lawsuit, or other matter. If any disputes, claims or matters arise in the future regarding the Scheduled Property, I will settle them all at my own expense and at my own risk and keep the Scheduled Property in your possession. I have all the rights in the Scheduled Property. I hereby give you this deed of transfer in your name, on the belief that I have not previously transferred the Scheduled Property to anyone else and that I have no equitable liabilities that can bind the Scheduled Property. This property is not owned by the Government as defined in the Act No. 9/77 of Shri A.P. Government. Not held as security by any Government or any other agency. Not acquired by assignment.
Schedule
Narasaraopet R.D., Narasaraopet Sub.D., Palnadu District, Rompicharla Mandal, Santagudipadu Gram Panchayat, all the property belonging to that village, acquired by my ancestors and registered in my name in the Panchayat records, and which has come to me as a result of my inheritance and which I have full rightful possession of.

This declaration is to inform that at the time of making this
document
the property, land, pass books, We have thoroughly examined all the necessary elements including 1B copies, link documents, tax receipts for the places/houses, details of the parties in the link documents, addresses of the parties, photos of the parties, details of the property and so on and have had the document prepared.
No elements that should have been written or included have been omitted from these documents.
The schedule property has been physically inspected and measured and the document has been drawn up. encumbranceDetails.description: VILL/COL:SANTHAGUDIPADU/SANTHAGUDIPADU(0-0)W-B: 0-0 SURVEY: 328 HOUSE: 8-1684 EXTENT:133.33SQ.Yds BUILT: 300SQ. FT Boundires: [N]:property of yerrabolu srinu [S] panchayathi road[E]: property of palaparthi siva [W]: property ofmeda srinivasarao

sections.content:
The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 1239 of 2026, dated 28/Jan/2026, executed by Kumbha Mangamma in favour of her Son, Kumbha Muttaiah towards the property admeasuring an extent of 133.33 Sq. Yds., bearing house number 8-1684, Assessment No. 1684, comprised in survey number 328, situated in Santhagudipadu Village & Grama Panchayati, Rompicherla Mandal, within the District of Palnadu, registered at sub-registrar office Narasaraopet, is bounded as follows:

North by: Property Of Yerrabolu Srinu
South by: Panchayathi Road
East by: Property Of Palaparthi Siva
West by: Property Of Meda Srinivasarao
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the scheduled property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note: It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
